rows.text_1_facilitator:
Today we are learning about spending one-on-one time with our children. 

Spending dedicated time with your child will make them feel valued and loved.
It will also build trust and respect, and support their learning.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Today we are learning about spending one-on-one time with our children. 

Spending dedicated time with your child will make them feel valued and loved.
It will also build trust and respect, and support their learning.

media_title.eng: Why is spending one-on-one time with your child important? Tap play to learn

media_transcript.eng:
Greetings everyone!

Our children don't need expensive gifts. The best gift we can give them is to spend one on one time with them.

By spending time together, you will understand your child better and they will learn many new things.

Having this time together with your child will feel special because it will help them feel loved and valued. That will make everything easier at home!

rows.media_title: Why is spending one-on-one time with your child important? Tap play to learn
rows.media_transcript:
Greetings everyone!

Our children don't need expensive gifts. The best gift we can give them is to spend one on one time with them.

By spending time together, you will understand your child better and they will learn many new things.

Having this time together with your child will feel special because it will help them feel loved and valued. That will make everything easier at home!

rows.text_1_facilitator:
One-on-one time can be fun for both of you!

Let‚Äôs look at how @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name and @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name do this.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
One-on-one time can be fun for both of you!

Let‚Äôs look at how @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name and @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name do this.

character_1_text.eng: I have 5 minutes and I would like to spend it with you, @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name. What would you like to do?

rows.character_1_text: I have 5 minutes and I would like to spend it with you, @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name. What would you like to do?
Wonderful idea, @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name! I see you are taking out the yellow scarf with blue stripes on it.

character_1_text.eng: Wonderful idea, @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name! I see you are taking out the yellow scarf with blue stripes on it.

character_2_text.eng: Thank you, I love this scarf!

rows.character_2_text: Thank you, I love this scarf!

character_1_text.eng: Well done for getting that dress on by yourself, @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name. You‚Äôre learning to do so many new things for yourself!

rows.character_1_text: Well done for getting that dress on by yourself, @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name. You‚Äôre learning to do so many new things for yourself!

text_2.eng:
How does @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name show her granddaughter, @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name, that she is focusing on her?

- üó£Ô∏è Saying @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name's name
- ü§ùüèæ Going down to her level
- üëÅÔ∏è Looking at @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name

quiz_1_question.eng: How do you think @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name and @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name feel after spending one-on-one time together?

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng:
Have another look at their facial expressions. 

@data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name‚Äôs and @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name probably feel closer, more relaxed and positive.

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng:
Yes! Spending just a few minutes of focused time with your child can help you feel closer, more relaxed and positive. 
By following @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name‚Äôs lead, using her name, and getting on her level, @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name is also helping her feel confident and valued.

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng:
Yes! Spending just a few minutes of focused time with your child can help you feel closer, more relaxed and positive. 
By following @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name‚Äôs lead, using her name, and getting on her level, @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name is also helping her feel confident and valued.

quiz_2_question.eng:
@data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name had fun playing dress-up. 
Who else can enjoy games like dress-up or soccer?

quiz_2_option_1_text.eng: Only girls like dress-up, boys like soccer

quiz_2_feedback_1.eng: Many people think that, but it's not true. All children can enjoy any game ‚Äì what matters is that they have fun and feel included.

quiz_2_option_2_text.eng: Some games are for boys, others for girls

quiz_2_feedback_2.eng: People often say that, but games are for everyone. When children can choose what they enjoy, they become more confident, creative, and learn to respect others too.

quiz_2_option_3_text.eng: All games are for all children

quiz_2_feedback_3.eng: That‚Äôs right! Every child ‚Äì girl or boy ‚Äì can enjoy any game. Letting them choose what they like helps them learn and be confident.

rows.text_1_facilitator: Here are some easy tips on how to connect with your child when you spend time together.

text_1_facilitator.eng: Here are some easy tips on how to connect with your child when you spend time together.

section_1_text.eng:
Spend at least 5 minutes a day with your child.
More time is even better!

section_2_text.eng:
Turn off the TV, put down your phone, and remove distractions.
Show your child you‚Äôre really listening and paying attention!

section_2_extra_text.eng:
- Look at your child. Get down to their level. Use their name.
- Describe what they are doing and feeling. Praise them.
- Your child will learn a lot from what you say and do.

section_3_text.eng: Let your child choose what to do or talk about. It helps them feel important. Ask to spend time together and try fun (or even silly!) activities.

rows.section_1_text:
Spend at least 5 minutes a day with your child.
More time is even better!
rows.section_2_text:
Turn off the TV, put down your phone, and remove distractions.
Show your child you‚Äôre really listening and paying attention!
rows.section_2_extra_text:
- Look at your child. Get down to their level. Use their name.
- Describe what they are doing and feeling. Praise them.
- Your child will learn a lot from what you say and do.
rows.section_3_text: Let your child choose what to do or talk about. It helps them feel important. Ask to spend time together and try fun (or even silly!) activities.

rows.text_1_facilitator: Now that you have learned a few tips on how to connect with your child, let's come up with some practical ideas!

text_1_facilitator.eng: Now that you have learned a few tips on how to connect with your child, let's come up with some practical ideas!

quiz_1_question.eng: How can you spend one-on-one time with your child?

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng:
Great idea!

Do you ever feel like you have NO TIME and are exhausted? Try to think of ways to make daily activities, like bath time or dinner, fun together.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
Ready to try out your new skills? 

Your home activity is to spend 5 minutes (or more) of one-on-one time with your child, every day this week.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Ready to try out your new skills? 

Your home activity is to spend 5 minutes (or more) of one-on-one time with your child, every day this week.

media_title.eng: Hear how one-on-one time helped @data.characters.media_female_1.name and her child connect.

media_transcript.eng:
When I first heard I have to spend one-on-one time with my daughter, it was hard for me. I did not know when to do it or what to say. I did not want to spoil my daughter so that she thinks we have to do everything together. 

But I really wanted to build my relationship with her and I wanted her to open up about what was troubling her. 

So we tried the One-on-One Time. 

First, it felt weird, but it turned out to be fun! Now we play her favourite game together and talk about things happening at school and with her friends.

quiz_1_question.eng: Can you spend one-on-one time with your child every day this week?

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: That's great! Spending one-on-one time helps build trust and love between you and your child.

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng:
You can do it! Try to spend a few minutes each day with your child.
It can be something simple, like eating together or doing a chore side by side.

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng:
That‚Äôs okay. It gets easier as you build a routine.
At first, try finding moments that don‚Äôt take extra time‚Äî like doing a chore together.
